news_header: The top 10 graphite-producing countries include China, Madagascar, Mozambique, Brazil, India, Tanzania, Canada, Russia, South Korea, and North Korea. China leads with 1.27 million metric tons produced in 2024, accounting for 78% of global supply.
news_text: The demand for graphite is rising due to its use in lithium-ion batteries, which are essential for electric vehicles. The global graphite market is projected to grow at a CAGR of 6.9% from 2025 to 2032, reaching $13.35 billion. Other notable producers include Madagascar and Mozambique, with significant reserves and production increases.
